p: Previously, as pandemics in the 20th century, we experienced the Spanish flu, acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) and highly pathogenic avian influenza viruses ( 1– 4). However, in the 21st century, the frequency of epidemics seems to have increased markedly ( 5– 9). Regardless of the cause, the possibility of pandemics occurring more frequently in the near future must naturally be considered.
